abstract: Some of New York City's most competitive schools are decreasing students' workload amid growing concerns about health effects of over-scheduling and stress; studies show that long hours of homework increase risk of physical and mental health issues, like sleep deprivation, ulcers and headaches.
snippet: Some of New York City’s most competitive high schools, like Dalton, Trinity and Horace Mann, are working to address student stress.
lead_paragraph: Some of New York City’s most competitive high schools, like Dalton, Trinity and Horace Mann, are working to address student stress.

headline.main: At Elite Schools, Easing Up a Bit on Homework
headline.print_headline: At Elite Schools, Easing Up a Bit On Homework
headline.seo: Tough New York Private Schools Try to Lighten Load
